main event: A bright, silver-colored round or oval object was observed by a reliable witness at an altitude of approximately 75,000 feet over Kirksville, Missouri on January 22, 1962.
interesting points: The object was under observation for approximately 65 minutes, during which time it gained altitude to around 105,000 feet and its speed was estimated to be between 1,500-1,600 mph with some variations.
The object faded from view while still under observation.
Radar analysis confirmed the object as being a probable balloon, and the motion characteristics were consistent with a balloon flight.
A similar unidentified bright light was reported gliding over the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of North Carolina on the same date.
The report mentions that the object's performance and description led analysts to believe it could have been a satellite.
sighted object: A bright, silver-colored round or oval object
